snippet: Gov. Bobby Jindal issued an executive order after the Legislature rejected a bill protecting businesses that did not want to participate in same-sex ceremonies.
abstract: Critics contend Louisiana Gov Bobby Jindal's executive order protecting those who do not support same-sex marriage is political move tied to potential 2016 presidential run; order comes after state legislators reject bill aimed at protecting businesses and other entities that refuse on religious grounds to recognize same-sex marriage.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Bobby Jindal issued an executive order after the Legislature rejected a bill protecting businesses that did not want to participate in same-sex ceremonies.

headline.main: Critics Say Jindal Order on Same-Sex Marriage Is Motivated by 2016 Campaign Bid
headline.print_headline: Critics Say Jindal Act Is Linked to 2016 Bid

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
